info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 27 at 3:58PM EDT until July 27 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHWESTERN FREDERICK COUNTIES IN NORTH CENTRAL MARYLAND AND NORTH CENTRAL LOUDOUN COUNTIES IN NORTHERN VIRGINIA... At 358 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Brunswick, or 7 miles east of Shepherdstown, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Frederick, Ballenger Creek, Brunswick, Braddock Heights, Point Of Rocks, Adamstown, Jefferson, Lovettsville, Buckeystown, Rosemont, Rohrersville, Burkittsville, Gapland, Brownsville, Antietam, Doubs, Petersville, Pleasantville, Neersville and Clifton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Sterling Virginia. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
